DataElement.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test Complete Version Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The version completed for the Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Ziad Nasreddine in 1996 to screen for mild cognitive dysfunction and impairment. This instrument assesses the following cognitive domains: attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Ziad Nasreddine in 1996 to screen for mild cognitive dysfunction and impairment. This instrument assesses the following cognitive domains: attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation.

Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale developed by Ziad Nasreddine in 1996 to screen for mild cognitive dysfunction and impairment. This instrument assesses the following cognitive domains: attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/15/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test Version Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The version of the Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alternate version of MOCA v8 that can be administered to decrease any potential test re-test interactions.

Concepts.definition: An alternate version of MOCA v8 that can be administered to decrease any potential test re-test interactions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The version of the Montreal Cognitive Assessment that added the Memory Index Score to the MoCA test. It contains additional scoring precisions and replaced version 7.1.

Concepts.definition: The version of the Montreal Cognitive Assessment that added the Memory Index Score to the MoCA test. It contains additional scoring precisions and replaced version 7.1.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alternate version of MOCA v8 that can be administered to decrease any potential test re-test interactions.

Concepts.definition: An alternate version of MOCA v8 that can be administered to decrease any potential test re-test interactions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/17/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ReferenceDocuments.name: which version of the MoCA cog
ReferenceDocuments.description: which version of the MoCA cognitive assessment was completed?
